thread.title: ALDOT revises I-65 lane closure schedule for I-22 interchange construction
thread.title_full: ALDOT revises I-65 lane closure schedule for I-22 interchange construction

author: Joe Songer | jsonger@al.com
title: ALDOT revises I-65 lane closure schedule for I-22 interchange construction
text:
Comments 
The Alabama Department of Transportation (ALDOT) has just revised the I-65 lane closure schedule at the I-22 interchange construction site. 
Weather permitting work will proceed as follows on I-65 northbound between Daniel Payne Drive (milepost 264) and Walkers Chapel Road (milepost 267). The schedule includes both single and double lane closures through early Wednesday August 26. 
The revision was posted around noon and will affect motorists driving in the area north of Birmingham for the next five days. The new lane closure schedule is as follows: 
路 Saturday, August 22- single lane closure from 7 p.m. until 9p.m. and double lane closure from 9 p.m. until 10 a.m. Sunday, August 23. 
路 Sunday, August 23- single lane closure from 7 p.m. til 6 a.m. 
路 Monday, August 24- single lane closure from 7 p.m. til 6 a.m. 
路 Tuesday, August 25- single lane closure from 7 p.m. til 6 a.m. 
Lane closures are needed to pour bridge decks. Two Alabama State Troopers will be on site throughout the five days of lane closures. 
ALDOT wants motorists to be aware that a reduced speed limit of 45 mph is in effect throughout the work zone. Motorists should expect major delays during this operation and are requested to consider using alternate routes, adjust arrival/departure times, observe work zone speed limits and other work zone signs, and use extreme caution in this area. 
I-22, when completed, is an Interstate Highway that will follow the U.S. 78 corridor (Corridor X) on a 213-mile-long route from Memphis, Tennessee, to Birmingham, Alabama.
